refnamediv.refpurpose: convert mCRL LPEs to mCRL2 LPEs

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The &tbf2lpe; tool translates linear process equations (LPEs) from the mCRL format (.tbf) to the mCRL2 format (.lpe).

Although the basic translation only changes the storage format of the LPE, some conversions are applied to generate an LPE that all mCRL2 tools can use as can be expected. Specifically, this means that the constructors &Bool_F; and &Bool_T; of sort &Bool; are converted to their mCRL2 counterparts (&Bool_false; and &Bool_true;) as well as the functions &Bool_and; and &Bool_or; (to &Bool_and2; and &Bool_or2;) and all equalities &Bool_eq; (to &Bool_eq2;). The conversion of &Bool_F; and &Bool_T; is needed for detecting whether or not a boolean expression is equal to true or false, which is necessary for simulation and state space generation, for example. The other conversions (of &Bool_and;, &Bool_or; and &Bool_eq;) are not necessary, but allow for elimination of sum variables (which can significantly speed up state space generation).
